revised_title: Michael Meredith Swann's Contributions to Cell Biology and Fertilization Research
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Michael Meredith Swann, a distinguished scientist who made significant contributions to the fields of cell biology and fertilization research. Swann's work focused on the birefringence of the mitotic apparatus of sea-urchin eggs, the mechanical properties of the cell surface, and the study of fertilization and the block to polyspermy. His research methods involved the use of polarizing microscopy, microdensitometry, and the development of the "cell elastimeter" or "sucker" apparatus.
